title: Doppler Effect Calculation üöó
ques: An ambulance with siren at **800 Hz** approaches you at **30 m/s**. What frequency do you hear? (v_sound = 340 m/s)
explanation: When source approaches, wavelengths compress, increasing observed frequency. This is why ambulance sirens sound higher-pitched when approaching.

title: Snell's Law Refraction üîç
ques: Light travels from air (n=1) into glass (n=1.5) at **45¬∞** angle. Find the **refracted angle**.

answer.content:
**Snell's Law:** n‚ÇÅ sin Œ∏‚ÇÅ = n‚ÇÇ sin Œ∏‚ÇÇ

**Calculation:**
$$\sin Œ∏_2 = \frac{n_1 \sin Œ∏_1}{n_2} = \frac{1 √ó \sin 45¬∞}{1.5}$$
$$\sin Œ∏_2 = \frac{0.707}{1.5} = 0.471$$
$$Œ∏_2 = \sin^{-1}(0.471) = \mathbf{28.1¬∞}$$

explanation: Light bends toward the normal when entering a denser medium (higher refractive index).

title: Lens Equation Problem üî¨
ques: A converging lens (f = 20 cm) has an object at 30 cm. Find image distance and magnification.

answer.content:
**Lens Equation:** 1/f = 1/v - 1/u

**Given:** f = 20 cm, u = -30 cm

$$\frac{1}{v} = \frac{1}{20} + \frac{1}{30} = \frac{3 + 2}{60} = \frac{5}{60}$$

**Image distance:** v = **60 cm** (real, on opposite side)

**Magnification:** m = -v/u = -60/(-30) = **-2** (inverted, 2√ó larger)

explanation: Positive v means real image. Negative magnification means inverted. Object beyond f creates real, inverted image.

explanation: Interference creates alternating bright and dark fringes. Larger wavelength or screen distance gives wider fringes.

title: Polarization üï∂Ô∏è
ques: Unpolarized light of intensity I‚ÇÄ passes through two polarizers at 60¬∞ angle. Find final intensity.

answer.content:
**After first polarizer:** I‚ÇÅ = I‚ÇÄ/2

**After second polarizer (Malus's Law):**
$$I_2 = I_1 \cos^2 Œ∏ = \frac{I_0}{2} √ó \cos^2 60¬∞$$

explanation: First polarizer halves intensity (blocks half of unpolarized light). Second follows Malus's Law.

title: Standing Waves in String üé∏
ques: A guitar string (L = 0.65 m) produces fundamental frequency 330 Hz. Find wave speed and first overtone frequency.

answer.content:

title: Resonance in Tubes üé∫
ques: An open pipe resonates at 440 Hz (A note). Find its length and first three harmonics. (v = 340 m/s)

answer.content:
**Open pipe fundamental:** Œª = 2L, so L = v/(2f)

**Length:** L = 340/(2 √ó 440) = **0.386 m**

**Harmonics (all integers):**
- 1st: 440 Hz
- 2nd: 880 Hz
- 3rd: 1320 Hz

explanation: Open pipes have antinodes at both ends and produce all harmonics. Closed pipes only odd harmonics.
